openstack%2Ftripleo-heat-templates~377842,openstack/tripleo-heat-templates,master,I663313e183bb05b35d0c5af016c2d1705c772bd9,Fix races in major-upgrade-pacemaker Step2,MERGED,2016-09-27 16:26:58.000000000,2016-09-29 14:56:41.000000000,41,17,"[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7065, 'name': 'Brad P. Crochet', 'email': 'brad@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcrochet'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}]",,0,"[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-29 05:42:18.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_2.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_3.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix races in major-upgrade-pacemaker Step2

tripleo-heat-templates/extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_2.sh
has the following code:
...
check_resource mongod started 600

if [[ -n $(is_bootstrap_node) ]]
column3:
do
        sleep 5
        tnow=$(date +%s)
        if (( tnow-tstart > galera_sync_timeout ))
column4:
then
            echo_error ""ERROR galera sync timed out""
            exit 1
        fi
    done

    # Run all the db syncs
    cinder-manage db sync
...
fi

start_or_enable_service rabbitmq
check_resource rabbitmq started 600
start_or_enable_service redis
check_resource redis started 600
start_or_enable_service openstack-cinder-volume
check_resource openstack-cinder-volume started 600

systemctl_swift start

for service in $(services_to_migrate)
column5:
do
    manage_systemd_service start ""${service%%-clone}""
    check_resource_systemd ""${service%%-clone}"" started 600
done
""""""

The problem with the above code is that it is open to the following race
condition:
1) Bootstrap node is busy checking the galera status via cluster check
2) Non-bootstrap node has already reached: start_or_enable_service
   rabbitmq and later lines. These lines will be skipped because
   start_or_enable_service is a noop on non-bootstrap nodes and
   check_resource rabbitmq only checks that pcs status |grep rabbitmq
   returns true.
3) Non-bootstrap node can then reach the manage_systemd_service start
   and it will fail with stuff like:
  ""Job for openstack-nova-scheduler.service failed because the control
  process exited with error code. See \""systemctl status
  openstack-nova-scheduler.service\"" and \""journalctl -xe\"" for
  details.\n"" (because the db tables are not migrated yet)

This happens because 3) was started on non-bootstrap nodes before the
db-sync statements are complete on the bootstrap node. I did not feel
like changing the semantics of check_resource and remove the noop on
non-bootstrap nodes as other parts of the tree might rely on this
behaviour.

Depends-On: Ia016264b51f485b97fa150ebd357b109581342ed
Change-Id: I663313e183bb05b35d0c5af016c2d1705c772bd9
Closes-Bug: #1627965
'}]",377842,ad07a29f9474ef68d0edf218638fe6030c019629,20172,Michele Baldessari,michele,0,"Fix races in major-upgrade-pacemaker Step2

The config option `[saml]/idp_sso_endpoint must have some value in
order for `keystone-manage saml_idp_metadata` to generate metadata with
a valid ns0:SingleSignOnService node. However, currently it does not
otherwise have any significance. For now let's simplify configuration
by providing a default value for that option. This patch also updates
the documentation to explain the parameter and avoid overstating its
importance.

Change-Id: Iaa972bb9349a244071880de74542cfe5c283f98f

validates.

can be used as an argument for intrinsic functions.

to set maintenance=False. This is to ensure backwards compatibility
with tools using the standard node.update mechanism, rather than
the new API endpoint), for setting maintenance mode.

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    ""UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later.""

This patch fixes all the warnings from:

    nova.tests.unit.api.openstack.compute.test_shelve.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: I39cca6587f99cfe6f980b6d8fe857618fac6bb5a
Related-Bug: #1568414
'}]",375894,2f670bf40c6de91bff1fe046c8c4f5eb81d8ccbb,16907,Diana Clarke,diana-clarke,0,"Fix database poison warnings, part 16

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible~375757,openstack/openstack-ansible,master,Ie690f31b64c7381257634a9dbb2ee5b4197fd9bf,Move base environment directory to an argument,MERGED,2016-09-23 22:32:29.000000000,2016-09-29 14:04:17.000000000,36,8,"[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 12807, 'name': 'Steve Lewis (stevelle)', 'email': 'stevelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevelle'}, {'_account_id': 12892, 'name': 'Nolan Brubaker', 'email': 'nolan.brubaker@rackspace.com', 'username': 'nrb'}, {'_account_id': 19814, 'name': 'Travis Truman (automagically)', 'email': 'travis_truman@cable.comcast.com', 'username': 'trumant'}]",,4,"[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-09-28 22:26:16.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer-docs/inventory.rst', 'playbooks/inventory/dynamic_inventory.py', 'tests/test_inventory.py'], 'message': 'Move base environment directory to an argument

In preparation for moving the current code into a new file but retaining
the existing dynamic_inventory.py entry-point, this change modifies the
main function so that can generate inventory without having to be in the
same directory as the env.d dir.

An initial attempt to move the `main` function of dynamic_inventory into a
structure like this:

    playbooks/
        inventory/
            env.d/
                <env files>
            dynamic_inventory.py
            lib/
                generate.py (contents of dynamic_inventory moved here)

resulted in errors when trying to access env.d due to using
os.path.join(__file__) inside the function. Also, incorporating this
change with the move would have resulted in a harder-to-review patch.

Instead, the `args` function will be left inside of dynamic_inventory.py
when `main` is moved out, so that the CLI-facing code is grouped
together.

Since the base environment was moved to a command line argument,
documentation was added as to its function, as well as the differences
from the --config argument.

As a side effect, this opens the door to running tests with multiple
environment layouts. However, none is added with this review.

Change-Id: Ie690f31b64c7381257634a9dbb2ee5b4197fd9bf
'}]",375757,57fef578689077b8bd59d77d06c20cf96f6bebd3,12892,Nolan Brubaker,nrb,0,"Move base environment directory to an argument

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible~375767,openstack/openstack-ansible,master,I8a4c677b44b7c0fc6d95c0a5213306165b79971d,Use detailed arguments for main function,MERGED,2016-09-23 23:14:33.000000000,2016-09-29 13:59:51.000000000,25,10,"[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 12807, 'name': 'Steve Lewis (stevelle)', 'email': 'stevelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevelle'}, {'_account_id': 12892, 'name': 'Nolan Brubaker', 'email': 'nolan.brubaker@rackspace.com', 'username': 'nrb'}, {'_account_id': 19814, 'name': 'Travis Truman (automagically)', 'email': 'travis_truman@cable.comcast.com', 'username': 'trumant'}]",,6,"[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-28 21:05:26.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/inventory-main-function-arguments-8c43e4c7175937d3.yaml', 'playbooks/inventory/dynamic_inventory.py', 'tests/test_inventory.py'], 'message': ""Use detailed arguments for main function

The previous behavior for main took an arbitrary dictionary and looked
for keys within it. To decouple the main function from the args
function, this change instead formalizes the names for the arguments
to main, allowing for documentation of the expectations.

Since Ansible's default expected argument is `--list` and that would
collide with the Python `list` builtin function, the `kwargs` argument
is added to act as a catch-all. In practice, while Ansible passes the
list argument in, it does not change the script's behavior.

Change-Id: I8a4c677b44b7c0fc6d95c0a5213306165b79971d
""}]",375767,ca7df2fa3f76761719ec68930ff9e8cc66b0adb1,12892,Nolan Brubaker,nrb,0,"Use detailed arguments for main function
The previous behavior for main took an arbitrary dictionary and looked
for keys within it. To decouple the main function from the args
function, this change instead formalizes the names for the arguments
to main, allowing for documentation of the expectations.
Since Ansible's default expected argument is `--list` and that would
collide with the Python `list` builtin function, the `kwargs` argument
is added to act as a catch-all. In practice, while Ansible passes the
list argument in, it does not change the script's behavior.

'Default vnc.keymap to None

The recommendation from the libvirt developers is to not set a keymap on
the outside, instead have only the guest OS configure it as needed [1].
With the recent noVNC patches, instances have started receiving broken
keycodes due to a keymap being set.

[1] https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2009-May/msg00234.html

Change-Id: Ieda38fde3d434f5bd1c0003e42028713261c666d
Closes-Bug: 1622684
'}]",375333,9e16e4e8f9d3268434cf372478087ad745b4bc83,13252,Dr. Jens Harbott,jrosenboom,0,"Default vnc.keymap to None

If createDefaultInstanceSecurityGroupRules() method isn't extended
in its inheritors and SecurityGroups isn't created in application
with addGroupIngress() then no SecurityGroup is created by default.

It causes error in the NeutronNetworkBase class in its joinInstanceToNetwork()
method, which always attempt to update the OS::Neutron::Port resource with a
SecurityGroup attribute.

This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I126e81e653799a83211e608df7409f9a0672dfed
Closes-bug: #1602360
""}]",366145,05a0944670809be8fd3b458238a5016b5fa1b2ab,20563,Omar Shykhkerimov,oshykhkerimov,0,"Call addGroupingress() in init of NeutronSecurityGroupManager

parameters.

openstack%2Fpuppet-openstack_extras~378989,openstack/puppet-openstack_extras,master,I2f06619e74f5e07889e29a82401344dda67ef51a,repos: disable EPEL by default,MERGED,2016-09-28 20:14:04.000000000,2016-09-29 13:34:39.000000000,8,2,[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 9061, 'name': 'David Moreau Simard', 'email': 'moi@dmsimard.com', 'username': 'dmsimard'}, {'_account_id': 15519, 'name': 'Iury Gregory Melo Ferreira', 'display_name': 'Iury Gregory', 'email': 'iurygregory@gmail.com', 'username': 'iurygregory'}]",,0,"[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-28 20:14:04.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/repo/redhat/redhat.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/disable_epel-a07b06048465e7a1.yaml'], 'message': ""repos: disable EPEL by default

EPEL is not required when deploying OpenStack with RDO repositories.
In fact, it's causing some packaging conflicts for some dependencies,
and having it installed might cause some deployment failures.

To avoid this situation, let's disable its setup by default to improve
our user experience but add a note about why we disable it by default.

Change-Id: I2f06619e74f5e07889e29a82401344dda67ef51a
""}]",378989,e361c88af9f35bc9bc3e39bfdd12dc98653d9ff3,3153,Emilien Macchi,emilienm,0,"repos: disable EPEL by default
EPEL is not required when deploying OpenStack with RDO repositories.
In fact, it's causing some packaging conflicts for some dependencies,
and having it installed might cause some deployment failures.
To avoid this situation, let's disable its setup by default to improve
our user experience but add a note about why we disable it by default.

This module is now needed to get access to firewall for bridged frames,
as well as to /proc/ settings that are used by Neutron to enforce
firewall for all bridges.

Since nova-network does not pass -m physdev to any of its iptables
rules as Neutron does, the module is not automatically loaded, leaving
the firewall ineffective. For Neutron, the module loading is triggered
by the first -m physdev rule applied, so in general case there is no
visible breakage.

http://ebtables.netfilter.org/documentation/bridge-nf.html

Change-Id: I01cc6fe9198730a629a39349551ca3494dd4ac3a
Closes-Bug: #1611895
Closes-Bug: #1622914
'}]",370918,c2a1dfc53b064d3284fe7f40d2257d4f4d0a350f,9656,Ihar Hrachyshka,ihrachys,0,"Load br_netfilter module if present

16:28:40.000000000', 'date': '2016-09-26 16:28:40.000000000'}]",11,"[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-09-26 13:16:54.000000000', 'files': ['lib/glance'], 'message': 'Work around issue in glance_store swift driver

With [1] glance_store introduced default settings for user_domain_id and
project_domain_id. Sadly since these are always passed to the keystone
client, they override any settings to user_domain_name and
project_domain_name that are made in the config, leading to authentication
failures.

So as a workaround until [2] is fixed, we explicitly place the corresponding
domain_ids into the config.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/297665
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1620999

Change-Id: Ica81a1a176614392291f2db4cc6398ed30663aed
'}]",369675,890342ed878f4a8f556ae733b6bd6c872308a937,13252,Dr. Jens Harbott,jrosenboom,0,"Work around issue in glance_store swift driver

during Newton cycle. Let's add it to the language list
in openstack_dashboard.settings so that Indonesian is listed
by the language pull-down menu by default.

I am planning to make this process automated in near future
(hopefully in Ocata cycle).

openstack%2Fkeystone~378681,openstack/keystone,master,I5e792831dc808270f91f2c343e93e44a653b8676,Make test_v3_auth exercise the whole API,MERGED,2016-09-28 14:55:21.000000000,2016-09-29 13:21:04.000000000,105,64,[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}]",,3,"[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-28 20:23:39.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py'], 'message': ""Make test_v3_auth exercise the whole API

Throughout much of the v3 authentication tests, you'd see calls
directly into the token_provider_api. While this was convenient
because the backends were loaded automatically, it makes changing
the implementation of the backend harder because we're relying on
it in the tests by coding to it directly, instead of just testing
the behavior through the API.

This commit makes it so that all calls to validate a token actually
use the token API instead of passing tokens directly to the
token_provider_api, exercising a request from the controller to the
backend... no cheat days here!

Change-Id: I5e792831dc808270f91f2c343e93e44a653b8676
""}]",378681,7f3296d4c558b4d14b218c7910bc8683e0f60ba0,5046,Lance Bragstad,ldbragst,0,"Make test_v3_auth exercise the whole API

openstack%2Finstack-undercloud~379322,openstack/instack-undercloud,master,I8b8963c97b9e8c2a31b5f554f737d95685bc330a,Use kwargs when creating mistralclient,MERGED,2016-09-29 09:42:41.000000000,2016-09-29 13:13:01.000000000,6,2,[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4978, 'name': 'Julie Pichon', 'email': 'jpichon@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpichon'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}]",,0,"[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-29 09:42:41.000000000', 'files': ['instack_undercloud/undercloud.py'], 'message': 'Use kwargs when creating mistralclient

Recently in If6ff35e91c3d35c2741332c7e739bb92b1234c54 a refactor of the
authentication in Mistral client stopped it accepting *args and now it
only accepts **kwargs.

kwargs were always expected, but Python will allow you to implicitly
pass them based on the order, but as this was removed and now **kwargs
is in the method signature it wont work.

This is a regression in mistralclient.

Closes-Bug: #1628853
Change-Id: I8b8963c97b9e8c2a31b5f554f737d95685bc330a
'}]",379322,56e65af08467cf4542c9fde393a61bf3adc3ce42,9712,Dougal Matthews,dougal,0,"Use kwargs when creating mistralclient
Recently in If6ff35e91c3d35c2741332c7e739bb92b1234c54 a refactor of the
authentication in Mistral client stopped it accepting *args and now it
kwargs were always expected, but Python will allow you to implicitly
pass them based on the order, but as this was removed and now **kwargs
is in the method signature it wont work.
This is a regression in mistralclient.

,['instack_undercloud/undercloud.py']

Crochet', 'email': 'brad@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcrochet'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]",,0,"[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-28 10:29:33.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker_migrations.sh'], 'message': 'Full HA->HA NG migration might fail setting maintenance-mode

Currently we do the following in the migration path:
pcs property set maintenance-mode=true
if ! timeout -k 10 300 crm_resource --wait
column2:
then
     echo_error ""ERROR: cluster remained unstable after setting maintenance-mode for more than 300 seconds, exiting.""
     exit 1
fi

crm_resource --wait can actually take forever under certain conditions.
The property will be set atomically across the cluster nodes so we should be good
without this.

Change-Id: I8f531d63479b81d65b572c4431c9db6f610f7e04
Closes-Bug: #1628393
'}]",378317,35da6af8bd1629ea823aecdd0e15b73fcbccf7b0,20172,Michele Baldessari,michele,0,"Full HA->HA NG migration might fail setting maintenance-mode

Hyper-V supports UEFI SecureBoot since the 2012 R2 version
for Windows guests and this has been extended to Linux
guests as well with the upcoming release. This blueprint
implements UEFI SecureBoot for Linux guests.
DocImpact: The nova flavor extra specs docs needs to be updated
to include 'os:secure_boot' and its possible values. The
image metadata property docs needs to be updated to include
os_secure_boot"" property and its possible values.

Nova has been installing an empty policy file in devstack for a while
now because it's not necessary to define rules in policy.json if you are
okay running with the defaults set in code. However oslo.policy did
require that the policy.json file exist, even if empty, until 1.14.0. By
updating the min required version Nova, and other projects, can remove
the useless empty policy file.

Change-Id: I09fa842ffbe75bed269cef6edc9c82d18bfe9297
""}]",378946,54bb2863f12eb9b70e08ead68bfdd94c0697fbfc,5441,Andrew Laski,alaski,0,"Update oslo.policy to >= 1.14.0

openstack%2Fpuppet-openstack-integration~379008,openstack/puppet-openstack-integration,master,I94a586b333ba6a99ef831c853a19ab127b502d6f,Update SSL certificates with SubjectAltNames,MERGED,2016-09-28 21:30:16.000000000,2016-09-29 12:44:56.000000000,199,92,[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 9061, 'name': 'David Moreau Simard', 'email': 'moi@dmsimard.com', 'username': 'dmsimard'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}]",,0,"[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-29 04:20:19.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/ssl-ipv4.conf', 'files/ipv6.crt', '.gitignore', 'files/ipv4.key', 'contrib/ssl-ipv6.conf', 'files/ipv6.key', 'files/ipv4.crt', 'README.md'], 'message': ""Update SSL certificates with SubjectAltNames

A recent update to urllib tightened some checks around SSL [1].
This prompted an update to Devstack in order to work properly [2].

Jobs running into this problem without having a SubjectAltName
provided will see an error that looks like:

    SSLError: hostname '127.0.0.1' doesn't match either of
    '127.0.0.1', 'localhost'

Let's also update the certificates to provide the SubjectAltName
and provide a way to easily update the certificates if required
in the future.

Let's also update the certificates to provide the SubjectAltName

openstack%2Fpuppet-openstack-integration~379009,openstack/puppet-openstack-integration,stable/mitaka,I94a586b333ba6a99ef831c853a19ab127b502d6f,Update SSL certificates with SubjectAltNames,MERGED,2016-09-28 21:31:03.000000000,2016-09-29 12:32:44.000000000,199,92,[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}]",,0,"[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-29 04:22:21.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/ssl-ipv4.conf', 'files/ipv6.crt', '.gitignore', 'files/ipv4.key', 'contrib/ssl-ipv6.conf', 'files/ipv6.key', 'files/ipv4.crt', 'README.md'], 'message': ""Update SSL certificates with SubjectAltNames

A recent update to urllib tightened some checks around SSL [1].
This prompted an update to Devstack in order to work properly [2].

Jobs running into this problem without having a SubjectAltName
provided will see an error that looks like:

    SSLError: hostname '127.0.0.1' doesn't match either of
    '127.0.0.1', 'localhost'

Let's also update the certificates to provide the SubjectAltName
and provide a way to easily update the certificates if required
in the future.

[1]: https://github.com/shazow/urllib3/blob/df9d503a8ea767e8a2ee95b3e75a914480c93de6/CHANGES.rst#118-2016-09-26
[2]: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/?id=69e3c0aac99981f17c76c22111e5c397824b8428

Change-Id: I94a586b333ba6a99ef831c853a19ab127b502d6f
(cherry picked from commit 61ba93a2b0b7f812107e700c6fd952cf567d50c6)
""}]",379009,c03c21c1e8f0b0d52a715bb650d27e48d82bdb99,9061,David Moreau Simard,dmsimard,0,"Update SSL certificates with SubjectAltNames

openstack%2Ftrove~379306,openstack/trove,master,Ie0f912786f7f2ea2a8839c9df5314e3e5f26cd0a,Put py34 first in the env order of tox,ABANDONED,2016-09-29 09:21:36.000000000,2016-09-29 11:51:21.000000000,1,1,"[{'_account_id': 9664, 'name': 'amrith', 'email': 'amrith.kumar@gmail.com', 'username': 'amrith'}, {'_account_id': 22752, 'name': 'Hanxi Liu', 'email': 'apolloliuhx@gmail.com', 'username': 'Hanxi_Liu'}]",,0,"[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-29 09:21:36.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of ""db type could not be determined"" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: Ie0f912786f7f2ea2a8839c9df5314e3e5f26cd0a
Closes-bug: #1604734
'}]",379306,6d7fa0f3789961e0a3562adfb081be463150018e,22752,Hanxi Liu,Hanxi_Liu,0,"Put py34 first in the env order of tox
To solve the problem of ""db type could not be determined"" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

,['tox.ini']
openstack%2Fnova~377093,openstack/nova,master,I48024952865fe017e0cb786567b5b445b05e7659,Stop overwriting thread local context in ClientRouter,MERGED,2016-09-26 20:49:47.000000000,2016-09-29 11:48:03.000000000,34,1,[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13393, 'name': 'Kenneth Burger', 'email': 'burgerk@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'burgerk'}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]","[{'rev_nbr': 1, 'author': '2016-09-26 21:56:23.000000000', 'date': '2016-09-26 21:56:23.000000000'}, {'rev_nbr': 1, 'author': '2016-09-26 22:30:26.000000000', 'date': '2016-09-26 22:30:26.000000000'}, {'rev_nbr': 1, 'author': '2016-09-26 23:39:44.000000000', 'date': '2016-09-26 23:39:44.000000000'}]",5,"[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-26 20:49:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/rpc.py', 'nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1627838.py'], 'message': 'Stop overwriting thread local context in ClientRouter

In commit 4df0869, a ClientRouter was added to cache client connections
to cell message queues. The periodic task for removing stale clients
is called with an empty RequestContext, but this overwrites the copy
in thread local storage unless overwrite=False is specified.

This adds overwrite=False to the empty RequestContext to prevent it
from overwriting the thread local context. All of the other periodic
tasks use get_admin_context() which also creates a RequestContext with
overwrite=False.

Closes-Bug: #1627838

Change-Id: I48024952865fe017e0cb786567b5b445b05e7659
'}]",377093,d218f0df65729e2818a63a22f9eb476d376e168e,4690,melanie witt,melwitt,0,"Stop overwriting thread local context in ClientRouter
In commit 4df0869, a ClientRouter was added to cache client connections
to cell message queues. The periodic task for removing stale clients
is called with an empty RequestContext, but this overwrites the copy
in thread local storage unless overwrite=False is specified.
This adds overwrite=False to the empty RequestContext to prevent it
from overwriting the thread local context. All of the other periodic
tasks use get_admin_context() which also creates a RequestContext with

Since we have changed the authentication of API endpoints in nailgun
(/api/version specifically) we cannot expect HTTP code 200 from nailgun
anymore. The functional tests install and run nailgun, checking whether
it is ready to serve request by quering the /api/version endpoint and
waiting for HTTP code 200. The commit changes this logic to accept any
return code except 000, since any valid HTTP return code shows that
nailgun is ready.


Change-Id: I457fffc3fe9bd15b8ce07d5fca13bced44d8127a
Closes-Bug: #1621000

If a config file has a '.yaml' or '.yml' suffix, load it as YAML
instead of using the iniparser.

YAML files are arguably easier to read and have better support for
long strings and lists. Switching to YAML files also makes MultiStrOpt
redundant, which in the very long term may allow us to remove it.

blueprint yaml-config
Change-Id: I5274eadfbd73738d04f90edbb2b76590efdf5b92

openstack%2Foslo.log~316162,openstack/oslo.log,master,Ia9e1566743015440f029f161b10252ae427c07d8,log: Spooling logger and manager,ABANDONED,2016-05-13 15:43:52.000000000,2016-09-29 11:05:11.000000000,189,0,"[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 7579, 'name': 'jan grant', 'email': 'jan.grant@hpe.com', 'username': 'jang'}, {'_account_id': 8688, 'name': 'Alexis Lee', 'email': 'openstack@lxsli.co.uk', 'username': 'lxsli'}, {'_account_id': 8768, 'name': 'Chris Friesen', 'email': 'chris.friesen@windriver.com', 'username': 'cbf123'}]",,20,"[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-08-15 13:52:48.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/spool.py', 'oslo_log/tests/unit/test_spool.py'], 'message': 'log: Spooling logger and manager

In the Nova scheduler, a lot of logs are produced per request which
are never looked at. We could cache these log records in memory and
only handle them if the overall request fails.

This patch provides a SpoolManager which you can set up for EG 'api'
requests. You can then ask it for a SpoolLogger, which will get a name
like ""spool.api.<request id>"". You pass this logger to the request
processor, from which it will cache log records, and if there is an
exception you call #flush on it. The log records will be released and
propagate up to the ""spool.api"" logger, then ""spool"", then the root
logger. Configure these with your logging config file as usual.

If flush is not called then the log records will be collected when the
last hard reference to the SpoolLogger is removed. If you're worried
about lingering logger references, you can call clear to wipe the
records once you know you no longer need them.

Please check carefully for race conditions and memory leaks.

Implements: blueprint log-spooling
Change-Id: Ia9e1566743015440f029f161b10252ae427c07d8
'}]",316162,b9613a2cbcb4463f026a7a4a48e3397bb80b55de,8688,Alexis Lee,lxsli,0,"log: Spooling logger and manager
In the Nova scheduler, a lot of logs are produced per request which
are never looked at. We could cache these log records in memory and
only handle them if the overall request fails.
This patch provides a SpoolManager which you can set up for EG 'api'
requests. You can then ask it for a SpoolLogger, which will get a name
like ""spool.api.<request id>"". You pass this logger to the request
processor, from which it will cache log records, and if there is an
exception you call #flush on it. The log records will be released and
propagate up to the ""spool.api"" logger, then ""spool"", then the root
logger. Configure these with your logging config file as usual.
If flush is not called then the log records will be collected when the
last hard reference to the SpoolLogger is removed. If you're worried
about lingering logger references, you can call clear to wipe the
records once you know you no longer need them.
Please check carefully for race conditions and memory leaks.

Strip cookies containing brackets

Cookies with [ or ] characters in cause the VNC proxy server
to fail to obtain the token cookie. This is due to a bug in
python 2.7.9: https://bugs.python.org/issue22931

This patch strips any cookies containing '[' or ']'.

Change-Id: Ic13c49e95996ee69a025c0ce3d34315f06d4ab07
Co-Authored-By: Alexis Lee <lxsli@hpe.com>
Closes-Bug: #1496932

Currently the agent only supports checking for a single endpoint,
which it assumes is the API. Some services, for example Nova, are
composed of several smaller services (API, scheduler, conductor) and
we'd like to check that each of those are up. Also, some operators use
VIPs in front of their services and may want to monitor those in
addition to the internal endpoint.

Change-Id: I8475151b4bf9ca1b45b2886960c358f5de3cda04

openstack%2Fmonasca-agent~338350,openstack/monasca-agent,master,Ib5a9eec07cca7e6cec723393cab6c50ac24a4ee3,Clean up argparse declaration,ABANDONED,2016-07-06 15:38:39.000000000,2016-09-29 11:03:45.000000000,131,73,"[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 22044, 'name': 'Mark Reynolds', 'email': 'mark.reynolds2@hpe.com', 'username': 'reynmark'}]",,0,"[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-08 14:03:03.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_setup/main.py'], 'message': ""Clean up argparse declaration

I've attempted to sort the options into broad sections, making it
easier to find an option. I removed a couple of redundant directives
(EG default=False with action='store_true'). I put the option names
and params on one line with the help text last. I removed the
unnecessary +s between literal strings, Python will parse two strings
adjoined only by whitespace as a single literal.

Altogether I find this makes them easier to read, I hope you agree.

Change-Id: Ib5a9eec07cca7e6cec723393cab6c50ac24a4ee3
""}]",338350,b5706b1983624f4558fa9d9f6e6491a53482a532,8688,Alexis Lee,lxsli,0,"Clean up argparse declaration

openstack%2Foslo.log~333911,openstack/oslo.log,master,I940223628937b394e9b68005574f2b32a34de2af,log: Freeze log records before spooling,ABANDONED,2016-06-24 13:48:52.000000000,2016-09-29 11:03:39.000000000,65,8,[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}]",,0,"[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-15 13:52:48.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/spool.py', 'oslo_log/tests/unit/test_spool.py'], 'message': ""log: Freeze log records before spooling

It's common to pass an object (EG an instance) as part of a log
record, then mutate that object. This isn't a problem normally as the
log record has already been formatted and emitted but if we're going
to spool log records, this could lead to misleading logs.

Allow a 'freezer' function to be provided, either on the SpoolManager
or via the 'spooling' context manager. This function must return a
record which will not mutate. copy.deepcopy is a valid freezer
function. Optionally, it may also prune the record so it takes less
memory to spool, providing all the information required by the
formatter(s) is retained. If no function is supplied, the record must
not be mutated (nor any object it refers to).

Implements: blueprint log-spooling
Change-Id: I940223628937b394e9b68005574f2b32a34de2af
""}]",333911,4d6179a59912d52095340db3e20ad5d7a110ca7f,8688,Alexis Lee,lxsli,0,"log: Freeze log records before spooling
It's common to pass an object (EG an instance) as part of a log
record, then mutate that object. This isn't a problem normally as the
log record has already been formatted and emitted but if we're going
to spool log records, this could lead to misleading logs.
Allow a 'freezer' function to be provided, either on the SpoolManager
or via the 'spooling' context manager. This function must return a
record which will not mutate. copy.deepcopy is a valid freezer
function. Optionally, it may also prune the record so it takes less
memory to spool, providing all the information required by the
formatter(s) is retained. If no function is supplied, the record must
not be mutated (nor any object it refers to).

openstack%2Fmonasca-agent~336621,openstack/monasca-agent,master,Ie8b4282148b392f4123bd19e984d085df2cc6547,Tighten up the Python,ABANDONED,2016-07-01 15:28:45.000000000,2016-09-29 11:03:31.000000000,178,123,"[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2419, 'name': 'Roland Hochmuth', 'email': 'roland.hochmuth@hpe.com', 'username': 'roland-hochmuth-s'}, {'_account_id': 14123, 'name': 'Stefano Canepa', 'email': 'sc@linux.it', 'username': 'sc'}, {'_account_id': 15027, 'name': 'Michael Hoppal', 'email': 'michael.jam.hoppal@hpe.com', 'username': 'michael-hoppal'}, {'_account_id': 16168, 'name': 'Tomasz Trębski', 'email': 'kornicameister@gmail.com', 'username': 'trebskit'}, {'_account_id': 20033, 'name': 'Artur Basiak', 'email': 'artur.basiak@ts.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'abasiak'}]",,0,"[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-07-08 14:03:03.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_service_plugin.py', 'monasca_setup/detection/service_plugin.py'], 'message': ""Tighten up the Python

Looking at the code with an eye to a change, I saw some opportunities
for improvement. I've used list comprehensions to get rid of long-form
loops and established some instance variables as lists to get rid of
look-before-we-leap checks.

The __init__ method now accepts keyword arguments as keyword arguments
rather than just via dict.

Change-Id: Ie8b4282148b392f4123bd19e984d085df2cc6547

openstack%2Foslo.log~333912,openstack/oslo.log,master,I5a7c35610ea688ace03dc3bda5a265cd2c86773d,log: Limit spools in bytes,ABANDONED,2016-06-24 13:48:52.000000000,2016-09-29 11:03:21.000000000,43,11,"[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}]",,0,"[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-15 13:52:48.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/spool.py', 'requirements.txt', 'oslo_log/tests/unit/test_spool.py'], 'message': ""log: Limit spools in bytes

The count of records is a poor measure of the amount of memory
consumed. I imagine operators would prefer to limit their spools to
say 10MB each, instead of say 1000 records and hope that each record
is under 10KB.

This patch adds a means of so limiting, using pymple's asizeof method
to recursively size the log record. This is done after freezing, which
gives projects a chance to cut out unnecessary information.

Implements: blueprint log-spooling
Change-Id: I5a7c35610ea688ace03dc3bda5a265cd2c86773d
""}]",333912,c029cb93a82b5e99daa4116c6b520e719f7613fc,8688,Alexis Lee,lxsli,0,"log: Limit spools in bytes
The count of records is a poor measure of the amount of memory
consumed. I imagine operators would prefer to limit their spools to
say 10MB each, instead of say 1000 records and hope that each record
This patch adds a means of so limiting, using pymple's asizeof method
to recursively size the log record. This is done after freezing, which
gives projects a chance to cut out unnecessary information.

openstack%2Foslo.log~328988,openstack/oslo.log,master,Ia845f05e146b182f44e4ec89c131094a9cfb2d6c,log: SpoolFilter and 'spooling' context manager,ABANDONED,2016-06-13 12:51:42.000000000,2016-09-29 11:03:15.000000000,196,1,"[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8688, 'name': 'Alexis Lee', 'email': 'openstack@lxsli.co.uk', 'username': 'lxsli'}]",,1,"[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-08-15 13:52:48.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/spool.py', 'oslo_log/log.py', 'oslo_log/tests/unit/test_spool.py'], 'message': ""log: SpoolFilter and 'spooling' context manager

Having spools is all very well but how do you get messages logged to
normal loggers into the right spools? This patch adds a SpoolFilter to
the global filter which diverts messages with request_ids registered
with context manager to the registered spool.

Implements: blueprint log-spooling
Change-Id: Ia845f05e146b182f44e4ec89c131094a9cfb2d6c
""}]",328988,b7a70ae5769d03da4dbbf81a1b85158015b812b2,8688,Alexis Lee,lxsli,0,"log: SpoolFilter and 'spooling' context manager
Having spools is all very well but how do you get messages logged to
normal loggers into the right spools? This patch adds a SpoolFilter to
the global filter which diverts messages with request_ids registered
with context manager to the registered spool.

openstack%2Foslo.log~330043,openstack/oslo.log,master,Ibce8a61df5a07225ff4d240a644a042908b9741d,log: Add a global filter,ABANDONED,2016-06-15 16:15:06.000000000,2016-09-29 11:03:06.000000000,209,0,"[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 8688, 'name': 'Alexis Lee', 'email': 'openstack@lxsli.co.uk', 'username': 'lxsli'}]",,2,"[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-15 13:52:48.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/tests/unit/test_global_filter.py', 'oslo_log/global_filter.py', 'oslo_log/log.py'], 'message': ""log: Add a global filter

Victor identified on Ic58dafceefde1b109721a58631c223522bf4cc9c that
log filters are only applied by the logger they are added to. That is,
if you apply a filter to the root logger, it's only checked for
records that are sent directly to the root logger. It is not checked
for records that propagate there.

This patch adds a global filter, which is applied to every logger. You
can then add filters to the global filter, which will run on every
record, regardless of which logger they are sent to. Three stages of
filter are offered, with the suggestion that 'pre' and 'post' filters
are used to modify the record while 'mid' filters actually filter or
divert records.

Change-Id: Ibce8a61df5a07225ff4d240a644a042908b9741d
Co-Authored-By: Victor Stinner <vstinner@redhat.com>
""}]",330043,fca26d647878b89c0f00386edc3529f37927bbb1,8688,Alexis Lee,lxsli,0,"log: Add a global filter

[H102 H103] Newly contributed Source Code should be licensed under
the Apache 2.0 license.

comments, and must be left completely empty.

The tests for the <all-in> filter operator were matching its inputs
against stringified lists (""['aes', 'mmx']"" rather than ['aes', 'mmx']),
so were actually testing for substring matching. See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-July/098936.html
for discussion. This patch passes a list instead of a stringified list
to the matcher, to test that <all-in> behaves correctly when matching
against lists of strings.

Change-Id: I2f5a86b0e9596d901e2cb7dc943ea7d8a2ebc191
'}]",339576,15fdb1477430f31b4f963787a9b6ce348e819a84,18893,Miles Gould,pozorvlak,0,"Test <all-in> matches elements, not substrings

to the matcher, to test that <all-in> behaves correctly when matching

This patch movs the various db::mysql hiera settings into a
'mysql' specific service_config_settings section for each
service so that these will only get applied on the MySQL service
node. This follows a similar puppet-tripleo change where we
create the actual databases for all services locally on
the MySQL service node to avoid permission issues.

Change-Id: Ic0692b1f7aa8409699630ef3924c4be98ca6ffb2
Closes-bug: #1620595
Depends-On: I05cc0afa9373429a3197c194c3e8f784ae96de5f
Depends-On: I5e1ef2dc6de6f67d7c509e299855baec371f614d
""}]",376984,7ba552520787860c966900c8c1fd46e2aefd046c,360,Dan Prince,dan-prince,0,"Move db::mysql into service_config_settings
This patch movs the various db::mysql hiera settings into a
service so that these will only get applied on the MySQL service
node. This follows a similar puppet-tripleo change where we
create the actual databases for all services locally on
the MySQL service node to avoid permission issues.

the rabbit driver to only those options.

[1] https://www.rabbitmq.com/authentication.html

methods are: PLAIN, AMQPLAIN, or RABBIT-CR-DEMO. This patch restricts

openstack%2Fopenstack-manuals~377270,openstack/openstack-manuals,master,I46e8e02d7de00b08dff4648fe51a1da10bd053b9,Ubuntu mariadb install no longer prompts for pass,MERGED,2016-09-27 06:33:02.000000000,2016-09-29 09:55:13.000000000,1,3,[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 10607, 'name': 'Alexandra Settle', 'email': 'a.settle@outlook.com', 'username': 'asettle'}]",,2,"[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-29 01:51:49.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/source/environment-sql-database.rst'], 'message': 'Ubuntu mariadb install no longer prompts for pass

Installing Newton RC on Ubuntu 16.04,

apt-get install mariadb-server python-pymysql

no longer results in a prompt to set the root password,
bringing it into line with other distributions.

The install guide contains a reference to the previous behaviour

""Choose a suitable password for the database root account.""

which is no longer necessary, and as such this patch removes it.

Change-Id: I46e8e02d7de00b08dff4648fe51a1da10bd053b9
'}]",377270,c917116457d39cb692965247e8dc90942c11cbda,612,Tom Fifield,fifieldt,0,"Ubuntu mariadb install no longer prompts for pass
no longer results in a prompt to set the root password,
bringing it into line with other distributions.
The install guide contains a reference to the previous behaviour
Choose a suitable password for the database root account.""
which is no longer necessary, and as such this patch removes it.
The previous commit moved the glance options to a
central location. This commit adds additional help text to
Checked consistency and removed the tags according to wiki:

Now, freezer-agent backup nova to swift by default.
but more and more demand  backup it to the specified directory.
This patch fix it backup it to local.

backup nova usage:
freezer-agent --nova-inst-id 1983bb28-b962-4597-ab83-c7529594c1c5
--storage local --container /home/nfs

restore nova usage:

freezer-agent --nova-inst-id 1983bb28-b962-4597-ab83-c7529594c1c5
--restore-from-date 2016-04-28T09:55:50 --storage local
--container /home/nfs

Closes-Bug: #1576008
Implements blueprint: backup-nova-cinder-to-non-swift

Change-Id: I1e7e889e76b655465ffa1a1dd99d0ec66e2dcf0d
'}]",315547,7243e741ddcb5bea6b899fe3861593666a18bd29,14101,yapeng Yang,yapeng,0,"Backup nova to local

openstack%2Ffreezer~315085,openstack/freezer,master,I926ab3e7285d55b543b93d372afe35b3c74952a2,backup cinder_by_glance to local,ABANDONED,2016-05-11 14:39:36.000000000,2016-09-29 08:53:28.000000000,106,24,[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 14084, 'name': 'Einst Crazy', 'email': 'yu.changcai@99cloud.net', 'username': 'Einst'}]",,7,"[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-06-01 04:46:44.000000000', 'files': ['freezer/openstack/backup.py', 'freezer/job.py', 'freezer/openstack/osclients.py', 'freezer/openstack/restore.py'], 'message': 'backup cinder_by_glance to local

Freezer-agent backup volume_by_glance upload data to swift by default.
This patch backup it and metadata to local,Now.

usage:
backup:
freezer-agent --cinder-vol-id 0bd0d291-e75c-4fd9-b13b-058c335a8497
--storage local --containder /home/nfs

restore:

freezer-agent --action restore
--cinder-vol-id 0bd0d291-e75c-4fd9-b13b-058c335a8497
--storage local --container /home/nfs
--restore-from-date 2016-05-10T00:01:00

Closes-Bug: #1580415

Change-Id: I926ab3e7285d55b543b93d372afe35b3c74952a2
Implements blueprint: backup-nova-cinder-to-non-swift
'}]",315085,20b36e38e9fc5d2cc4825a36db81672411192fa5,14101,yapeng Yang,yapeng,0,"backup cinder_by_glance to local
Freezer-agent backup volume_by_glance upload data to swift by default.
This patch backup it and metadata to local,Now.

When sourcing the Keystone RC file, some of the variable options are
conflicting, and may provide the wrong information to a token request.
For example, If both OS_USERNAME and OS_USER_ID are passed, the
Keystone Client has to chose which one to add to the token request,
and it might not be the one the user expects.  The same is true for
any value that can be passed both by name and ID. In addition, some
of the combinations lead to cryptic error messages.

To clearly identify the users intention, the old environment is
cleared of all variables that start with the `OS_` prefix
before setting any new variables.

Change-Id: I6badc5864426a371323a59100155e1c284af84b8
'}]",347553,04f9600c69b95a6e56fa3591515a8f62b9a35223,2218,Adam Young,ayoung,0,"Clear the old environment in rc file
When sourcing the Keystone RC file, some of the variable options are
conflicting, and may provide the wrong information to a token request.
For example, If both OS_USERNAME and OS_USER_ID are passed, the
Keystone Client has to chose which one to add to the token request,
and it might not be the one the user expects.  The same is true for
any value that can be passed both by name and ID. In addition, some
of the combinations lead to cryptic error messages.
To clearly identify the users intention, the old environment is
cleared of all variables that start with the `OS_` prefix

,['tripleoclient/utils.py']

retag 3.0.0_rc1 of murano-dashboard 3.0.0.0rc1 release candidate

  * New upstream release.

   be deleted, delete rule raises KeyError if there's no key. Need to
   handle that case.

Change-Id: I77b1ed72db51a5bd292fb1ccbe5a06f5f06a5a8c

The library, which displays user interface, urwid,
executes ioctl on stdin file descriptor, which
works only on ttys. Let's report error, when we run
not on a tty to make error investigation easier.

Change-Id: I15e80f14f65f6467eca153dc2cd73c64751c9154
Partial-Bug: #1607402

At the gates Ironic uses VMs instead of real hardware servers.
Those VMs are not managed by Nova and is used for emulating hardware
servers for Ironic. In multinode topology those VMs are created on
all nodes primary and subnodes. This patch adds an extra vxlan tunnel
and new bridge br_ironic_vxlan to provide connectivity between VMs on
different nodes.

Change-Id: I8892a2418e3bee35dacce1d5959faa30dd38e971
'}]",335981,562325eaf5de64a57040274724bf1ccb3fe98239,14525,Vasyl Saienko,vsaienko,0,"Preparing multinode networking for Ironic

Improve some neutron scenarios,ABANDONED,2016-04-14 15:35:07.000000000,2016-09-29 08:00:53.000000000,93,35,"[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 14817, 'name': 'Mirantis Rally CI', 'email': 'rally-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ci50'}]",,0,"[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 15:35:07.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/plugins/openstack/scenarios/neutron/test_network.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/neutron/utils.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/neutron/network.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/scenarios/neutron/test_utils.py'], 'message': '[Scenarios] WIP! Improve some neutron scenarios

This changes the following scenarios:

  * NeutronNetworks.create_and_list_ports
     - bulk ports creation (single atomic action)
  * NeutronNetworks.create_and_update_ports
     - bulk ports creation (single atomic action)
     - bulk ports updating (single atomic action)
     - create all ports for given network and then update
       all these ports, instead of create-and-update action
       for each port
  * NeutronNetworks.create_and_delete_ports
     - bulk ports creation (single atomic action)
     - bulk ports deletion (single atomic action)
     - create all ports for given network and then delete
       all these ports, instead of create-and-delete action
       for each port

For bulk actions, the following methods are added to utils:

  * Neutron_scenario._create_ports
  * Neutron_scenario._update_ports
  * Neutron_scenario._delete_ports

Change-Id: I44fe8ee36e044db12b1349b2cb0c8b2b233b39d1
'}]",305938,a7f1d518acb5ab8f6cdde30c1364d441c12d7413,10475,Alexander Maretskiy,maretskiy,0,"[Scenarios] WIP! Improve some neutron scenarios

all these ports, instead of create-and-update action
- create all ports for given network and then delete

openstack%2Fceilometer~109994,openstack/ceilometer,master,I6b27ca2597c51b0656f441f325f9ffd0e31a606d,Fix dict and set order related issues in tests,MERGED,2014-07-28 12:48:59.000000000,2016-09-29 08:00:16.000000000,58,36,"[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 3012, 'name': 'Dina Belova', 'email': 'dbelova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dbelova'}, {'_account_id': 4491, 'name': 'Lianhao Lu', 'email': 'lianhao.lu@intel.com', 'username': 'lianhao-lu'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 7478, 'name': 'Nadya Shakhat', 'email': 'nadmi4@gmail.com', 'username': 'nprivalova'}, {'_account_id': 10987, 'name': 'Igor Degtiarov', 'username': 'tovstun', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 22752, 'name': 'Hanxi Liu', 'email': 'apolloliuhx@gmail.com', 'username': 'Hanxi_Liu'}]","[{'rev_nbr': 1, 'author': '2014-07-28 13:45:33.000000000', 'date': '2014-07-28 13:45:33.000000000'}, {'rev_nbr': 2, 'author': '2014-07-28 15:15:41.000000000', 'date': '2014-07-28 15:15:41.000000000'}, {'rev_nbr': 3, 'author': '2014-07-29 11:37:05.000000000', 'date': '2014-07-29 11:37:05.000000000'}, {'rev_nbr': 5, 'author': '2014-07-29 15:47:36.000000000', 'date': '2014-07-29 15:47:36.000000000'}, {'rev_nbr': 6, 'author': '2014-07-30 17:47:44.000000000', 'date': '2014-07-30 17:47:44.000000000'}, {'rev_nbr': 6, 'author': '2014-07-31 09:53:43.000000000', 'date': '2014-07-31 09:53:43.000000000'}]",2,"[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-07-30 16:33:19.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/test_utils.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py', 'ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_alarm_scenarios.py', 'tox.ini', 'ceilometer/tests/alarm/test_notifier.py'], 'message': ""Fix dict and set order related issues in tests

There are several tests where the expected output
relies on order of strings generated from the arbitrary
ordering of dictionaries or sets. The new version of
tox causes that ordering to be different between tests
runs so tests must be resilient and test either the
content of the dicts or sets or their sorted output.

Note: These fixes are only of those cases where a failure
was generated. If there are issues in skipped tests, this
patch has not found nor fixed them. The vast majority of
skipped tests are related to availability of functionality
so there's little that can be done about that with the
current testing setup. The best we can do is be on the
lookout for failures that could be related PYTHONHASHSEED
down the road and fix them as they happen.

Closes-Bug: 1348818
Change-Id: I6b27ca2597c51b0656f441f325f9ffd0e31a606d
""}]",109994,3a009031be349fb20738ba295a63c2fc2cefa4fd,11564,Chris Dent,chdent,0,"Fix dict and set order related issues in tests
There are several tests where the expected output
relies on order of strings generated from the arbitrary
ordering of dictionaries or sets. The new version of
tox causes that ordering to be different between tests
runs so tests must be resilient and test either the
content of the dicts or sets or their sorted output.
Note: These fixes are only of those cases where a failure
was generated. If there are issues in skipped tests, this
patch has not found nor fixed them. The vast majority of
skipped tests are related to availability of functionality
so there's little that can be done about that with the
current testing setup. The best we can do is be on the
lookout for failures that could be related PYTHONHASHSEED
down the road and fix them as they happen.

* Text search, then click facet, text hidden but still used

1. What is the problem?
In the original spec, there are some fuzzy descriptions:
 * Before we run the commands to test some functions in the Tricircle,
   we need to import the environment variables. So it is necessary to
   describe this file ""admin-openrc.sh"" more clearly before test.
 * When creating pod instances for Tricircle and bottom OpenStack,
   this document lack the instructions for the parameter ""token"".
 * Some volume actions tests lacked in this document.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
We add some descriptions about environment variables and parameter
""token"". We also add some volume actions tests in this document.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution?
None

openstack%2Ftripleo-heat-templates~378301,openstack/tripleo-heat-templates,master,I5bf6ee9eecebda40c0687dfce3582b84d862963c,Add a test bed node for overcloud deployments,ABANDONED,2016-09-28 07:30:28.000000000,2016-09-29 07:07:40.000000000,503,0,[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 20775, 'name': 'Carlos Camacho', 'email': 'ccamacho@redhat.com', 'username': 'ccamacho'}]",,1,"[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-09-29 07:05:09.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_testbed.pp', 'environments/testbed.yaml', 'overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/testbed-config.yaml', 'roles_data.yaml', 'puppet/testbed.yaml'], 'message': 'Add a test bed node for overcloud deployments

Currently there are incompatible services to be deployed
in the overcloud i.e. opencontrail which have dependency
issues with the overcloud controller.

This submission creates a new role called TestBed to deploy
third party and custom services in the overcloud.

How to deploy:

Update the content of environments/testbed.yaml to add the
new services to be deployed/tested in this new role. Then
deploy an overcloud using this env file.

i.e.

openstack overcloud deploy \
--libvirt-type qemu \
--ntp-server pool.ntp.org \
--templates /home/stack/tripleo-heat-templates \
-e /home/stack/tripleo-heat-templates/overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml \
-e /home/stack/tripleo-heat-templates/environments/testbed.yaml

Change-Id: I5bf6ee9eecebda40c0687dfce3582b84d862963c
'}]",378301,9e2866a7585a979c92dac49a565d97d7b601aa47,20775,Carlos Camacho,ccamacho,0,"Add a test bed node for overcloud deployments
Currently there are incompatible services to be deployed
in the overcloud i.e. opencontrail which have dependency
This submission creates a new role called TestBed to deploy
third party and custom services in the overcloud.
Update the content of environments/testbed.yaml to add the
new services to be deployed/tested in this new role. Then
deploy an overcloud using this env file.

openstack%2Fmistral~379131,openstack/mistral,stable/newton,I244c1768aaa306f8ad41084325107a40005d874c,Remove environment data from task inbound context,MERGED,2016-09-29 05:03:49.000000000,2016-09-29 06:40:14.000000000,11,37,"[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8731, 'name': 'Renat Akhmerov', 'email': 'renat.akhmerov@gmail.com', 'username': 'rakhmerov'}]",,0,"[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-29 05:03:49.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/engine/tasks.py', 'mistral/workflow/base.py', 'mistral/engine/workflows.py', 'mistral/services/workflows.py'], 'message': ""Remove environment data from task inbound context

* It's redundant to keep environment data in task inbound context,
  it is immutable and we can always take it from workflow execution
  object which is more efficient from DB space consumption
  standpoint. The only case when it's allowed to modify data
  in a workflow environment is when we either resume or re-run
  a workflow and in this case we can change it for the whole
  workflow execution.

Change-Id: I244c1768aaa306f8ad41084325107a40005d874c
(cherry picked from commit bdf49b7193383b8e5ac8aed4d3a36c6be96e6040)
""}]",379131,d9e734fa5b399bd72eff8c06e0264c2661cce4f6,8731,Renat Akhmerov,rakhmerov,0,"Remove environment data from task inbound context

reporting capabilities will be changed when huawei array License

create\manage\migrate\retype and so on. We will output the array
does not support this feature in the log file.

* It's redundant to keep environment data in task inbound context,
  it is immutable and we can always take it from workflow execution
  object which is more efficient from DB space consumption
  standpoint. The only case when it's allowed to modify data
  in a workflow environment is when we either resume or re-run
  a workflow and in this case we can change it for the whole
  workflow execution.

openstack%2Fmanila~354694,openstack/manila,stable/mitaka,Ief3b15eefc0fc325a2a5418fc7ac2724c315cc21,Fix concurrent usage of update_access method for share instances,MERGED,2016-08-12 12:20:20.000000000,2016-09-29 03:22:45.000000000,38,13,[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2417, 'name': 'Ben Swartzlander', 'email': 'ben@swartzlander.org', 'username': 'bswartz'}, {'_account_id': 8851, 'name': 'Valeriy Ponomaryov', 'email': 'kiparis.kh@gmail.com', 'username': 'vponomaryov'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 13144, 'name': 'Oracle ZFSSA CI', 'username': 'oracle-zfssa-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14567, 'name': 'Rodrigo Barbieri', 'email': 'rodrigo.barbieri@canonical.com', 'username': 'ganso'}]","[{'rev_nbr': 1, 'author': '2016-08-12 15:22:04.000000000', 'date': '2016-08-12 15:22:04.000000000'}, {'rev_nbr': 1, 'author': '2016-08-12 18:06:50.000000000', 'date': '2016-08-12 18:06:50.000000000'}, {'rev_nbr': 1, 'author': '2016-08-12 18:15:15.000000000', 'date': '2016-08-12 18:15:15.000000000'}, {'rev_nbr': 1, 'author': '2016-08-12 19:09:02.000000000', 'date': '2016-08-12 19:09:02.000000000'}, {'rev_nbr': 1, 'author': '2016-08-12 23:18:16.000000000', 'date': '2016-08-12 23:18:16.000000000'}]",0,"[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-12 12:20:20.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/test_access.py', 'manila/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'manila/share/manager.py', 'manila/share/access.py'], 'message': 'Fix concurrent usage of update_access method for share instances

In mitaka, update_access merged with a known concurrency issue.
This concurrency has been randomly failing in our CIs. This change
adds a lock mechanism to prevent that, while rules are being removed
by a thread, a parallel thread adds back or handle the same rules
that are being removed.

Also, a late mitaka update_access patch [1] broke share migration access
rules consistency, thus leaving stale access rule data on share server
that hosted the share prior to its migration. This patch addresses this
by preventing the refresh mechanism from adding back rules
that are removed.

[1] I0f863cbae4d8af0660114161deda7bf7aa60d71d

Change-Id: Ief3b15eefc0fc325a2a5418fc7ac2724c315cc21
Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Barbieri <rodrigo.barbieri2010@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthamr@netapp.com>
Closes-Bug: #1566815
Closes-Bug: #1609414
(cherry picked from commit d878826cf3524e9e2f1d972072c7844934509616)
'}]",354694,49c2f3b8c035bd5c5372c5874363701906fd4bb1,16643,Goutham Pacha Ravi,gouthamr,0,"Fix concurrent usage of update_access method for share instances
In mitaka, update_access merged with a known concurrency issue.
This concurrency has been randomly failing in our CIs. This change
adds a lock mechanism to prevent that, while rules are being removed
by a thread, a parallel thread adds back or handle the same rules
Also, a late mitaka update_access patch [1] broke share migration access
rules consistency, thus leaving stale access rule data on share server
that hosted the share prior to its migration. This patch addresses this
by preventing the refresh mechanism from adding back rules

Remove block_device_mapping preperty for os.nova.server profile
based on following reasons:
1) block_device_mapping_v2 property is more flexibility than
block_device_mapping property.
2) For nova server create api, block_device_mapping parameter
can't coexist with block_device_mapping_v2 parameter. So we
does't need to keep two types block device properties in our
os.nova.server profile.

Change-Id: I14c81e1157c32a7ccd838bfc91f8e3a0ddf5e0ef

openstack%2Fpython-tripleoclient~379021,openstack/python-tripleoclient,stable/newton,I583521c5c72a5377e9ee3047376c0f7bcf5fbdf6,Deprecate a number of CLI args that map directly to Heat params,MERGED,2016-09-28 22:13:58.000000000,2016-09-29 03:02:30.000000000,45,13,"[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}]",,0,"[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-28 22:13:58.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/utils.py'], 'message': 'Deprecate a number of CLI args that map directly to Heat params

For a while now the recommended approach for managing parameters has
been with a Heat environment file that is passed into the deploy
command. However, there are a number of CLI args that still map directly
to parameters. This change marks them as deprecated and includes
direction for users in the help message.

They can then be removed in a later release.

Change-Id: I583521c5c72a5377e9ee3047376c0f7bcf5fbdf6
'}]",379021,1b7b73125cceb58c174ea1ccb8d73463543533ae,9712,Dougal Matthews,dougal,0,"Deprecate a number of CLI args that map directly to Heat params
For a while now the recommended approach for managing parameters has
been with a Heat environment file that is passed into the deploy
command. However, there are a number of CLI args that still map directly
to parameters. This change marks them as deprecated and includes
direction for users in the help message.
They can then be removed in a later release.

,['tripleoclient/utils.py']

openstack%2Fcongress~379059,openstack/congress,stable/newton,I28f06eef3548e07367a3c3757892112a87391ce5,control_bus service has only 1 heartbeat thread,MERGED,2016-09-29 01:28:23.000000000,2016-09-29 02:34:12.000000000,6,1,"[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8878, 'name': 'Masahito Muroi', 'email': 'masahito.muroi@linecorp.com', 'username': 'masa'}, {'_account_id': 18591, 'name': 'Eric Kao', 'email': 'ekcs.openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'ekcs'}]",,0,"[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-29 01:28:23.000000000', 'files': ['congress/dse2/dse_node.py', 'congress/dse2/control_bus.py'], 'message': 'control_bus service has only 1 heartbeat thread

control_service class expects to have only one heartbeat thread.
But the service launchs a heartbeat thread everytime when
control_bus.start() is called. Thus control_bus has 3 methods
and sends 3 heartbeat messages always.

This adds a barrier to stop creating extra heartbeat threads in the class.

Change-Id: I28f06eef3548e07367a3c3757892112a87391ce5
Closes-Bug: #1622865
(cherry picked from commit 3785f810b5c59ff2ad2666de794c067e3733c90e)
'}]",379059,d32cb5ae2e248c1fb5c461d21b59e5000e8bb690,18591,Eric Kao,ekcs,0,"control_bus service has only 1 heartbeat thread
control_service class expects to have only one heartbeat thread.
But the service launchs a heartbeat thread everytime when
control_bus.start() is called. Thus control_bus has 3 methods
This adds a barrier to stop creating extra heartbeat threads in the class.

13:28:58.000000000', 'files': ['tools/hooks/post_test_hook.sh', 'tools/hooks/README'], 'message': ""Add a post-test-hook to run the archive command

The archive_deleted_rows command in nova-manage is often-broken and
not well tested by us. We can test it to some degree in functional tests,
but running it against a real database with real deleted stuff in it
is a good idea. This adds a post-test hook and runs the archive so that
after a full test run in the gate, we'll see the output. Later, we should
make a failed run of this fatal, but for now, just run it so we can see
how close we are to being able to gate on it.

Change-Id: I16b2e00eede6af455cb74ca4e6ca951d56fdbcbc
""}]",376567,6f988105ac86309c5308e2da88428ed6bff8b180,4393,Dan Smith,danms,0,"Add a post-test-hook to run the archive command
The archive_deleted_rows command in nova-manage is often-broken and
not well tested by us. We can test it to some degree in functional tests,
but running it against a real database with real deleted stuff in it
is a good idea. This adds a post-test hook and runs the archive so that
after a full test run in the gate, we'll see the output. Later, we should
make a failed run of this fatal, but for now, just run it so we can see
how close we are to being able to gate on it.

If a facet field is marked 'nested' use a nested query type, otherwise
treat is as any other field. This patch adds 'nested' to the
magicsearch facet objects, and passes the entire facet definition
to the query build function (as well as the selected key/value pair).

Change-Id: I628691d93c4d864964e53e2c1fb69c796868db1f
Partial-Bug: #1621289
Depends-On: If4200fdff2db7bef49843a3ff611fc4edf2eea58
""}]",379039,24894a16e56b9e1a3dd113ab0db1543d7210c8bf,7665,Travis Tripp,travis.tripp,0,"Honor 'nested' in facets
If a facet field is marked 'nested' use a nested query type, otherwise
treat is as any other field. This patch adds 'nested' to the
magicsearch facet objects, and passes the entire facet definition
to the query build function (as well as the selected key/value pair).

openstack%2Fcongress~371012,openstack/congress,master,I28f06eef3548e07367a3c3757892112a87391ce5,control_bus service has only 1 heartbeat thread,MERGED,2016-09-15 17:23:24.000000000,2016-09-29 01:28:24.000000000,6,1,[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 11278, 'name': 'Anusha Ramineni', 'email': 'anusha.ramineni@india.nec.com', 'username': 'anusha08'}, {'_account_id': 18591, 'name': 'Eric Kao', 'email': 'ekcs.openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'ekcs'}]",,0,"[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-15 17:23:24.000000000', 'files': ['congress/dse2/dse_node.py', 'congress/dse2/control_bus.py'], 'message': 'control_bus service has only 1 heartbeat thread

control_service class expects to have only one heartbeat thread.
But the service launchs a heartbeat thread everytime when
control_bus.start() is called. Thus control_bus has 3 methods
and sends 3 heartbeat messages always.

This adds a barrier to stop creating extra heartbeat threads in the class.

Change-Id: I28f06eef3548e07367a3c3757892112a87391ce5
Closes-Bug: #1622865
'}]",371012,3785f810b5c59ff2ad2666de794c067e3733c90e,8878,Masahito Muroi,masa,0,"control_bus service has only 1 heartbeat thread
control_service class expects to have only one heartbeat thread.
But the service launchs a heartbeat thread everytime when
control_bus.start() is called. Thus control_bus has 3 methods
This adds a barrier to stop creating extra heartbeat threads in the class.

Docker gateway recieves response message from daemon_factory over
service_out_fd, but it only read limited buffer size, so it can
leave some content unread.
This patch make sure that it reads all the content, while it also
fixes some lazy fd closing.

NOTE:
This patch also improves error handling about sbus communication.

Change-Id: Ie85562fa06a1463b11094fbe024ae6f48715b735
'}]",378685,9d6a79fa072734b72c5fe5a398eebd30a3c29a71,9816,Takashi Kajinami,kajinamit,0,"Make gateway read all content recieved over service_out_fd

openstack%2Fcongress~379036,openstack/congress,stable/newton,Ia6b2b3e9816c90d4ca6b687cca2fac90eb5fb9b3,Remove the traceback added by oslo-messaging RPC,MERGED,2016-09-28 23:36:48.000000000,2016-09-29 01:14:12.000000000,20,5,[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8215, 'name': 'Tim Hinrichs', 'email': 'timothy.l.hinrichs@gmail.com', 'username': 'thinrich'}]",,0,"[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-28 23:36:48.000000000', 'files': ['congress/api/webservice.py'], 'message': ""Remove the traceback added by oslo-messaging RPC

Remove the traceback added by oslo-messaging RPC, to avoid
displaying traceback to user.

Some requests that return traceback w/o this patch, now normal:
$ openstack congress policy row list bob p
Not Found::table 'p' doesn't exist (HTTP 404) (Request-ID: req-54c2a117-0306-4fd2-8d71-8f7e6d130a43)
$ openstack congress policy rule list bob
The specified policy does not exist.::Policy ID bob does not exist
(HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-d85db619-afa0-4977-99f8-0dc88c5daa0c)
$ openstack congress policy delete bob
Policy Name or ID 'bob' does not exist (HTTP 404) (Request-ID: req-e1a70735-f469-4fae-b278-f061b64f4298)
$ openstack congress policy show bob
Resource bob not found (HTTP 404)

The 400 error should be addressed in separate patch.

Change-Id: Ia6b2b3e9816c90d4ca6b687cca2fac90eb5fb9b3
Closes-Bug: #1620868
""}]",379036,c9bfcdd0fe4c66f5766e62f03f8eea598954520d,18591,Eric Kao,ekcs,0,"Remove the traceback added by oslo-messaging RPC
Remove the traceback added by oslo-messaging RPC, to avoid
Some requests that return traceback w/o this patch, now normal:
$ openstack congress policy row list bob p
$ openstack congress policy rule list bob
The specified policy does not exist.::Policy ID bob does not exist
Policy Name or ID 'bob' does not exist (HTTP 404) (Request-ID: req-e1a70735-f469-4fae-b278-f061b64f4298)
The 400 error should be addressed in separate patch.

,['congress/api/webservice.py']

'date': '2016-09-17 10:31:58.000000000'}]",23,"[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-09-17 08:57:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/blockinfo.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_blockinfo.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Use the recreated disk.config.rescue during a rescue

I931421ea introduced a callback to _create_configdrive from
_create_domain during a rescue that recreates the config disk of an
instance with an additional .rescue suffix. However due to a latent bug
neither the original or this recreated config disk are mapped to the
instance during the resulting rescue.

To correct this disk.config.rescue is now added to the disk_mapping for
the instance if a config disk is required during a rescue.

Closes-bug: #1597669
Change-Id: I46cebd0612f50ff7373f677c4a002d444a877972
'}]",335884,8795b206247fe2ca57f32c437d72c51492637649,10135,Lee Yarwood,lyarwood,0,"libvirt: Use the recreated disk.config.rescue during a rescue
I931421ea introduced a callback to _create_configdrive from
_create_domain during a rescue that recreates the config disk of an
instance with an additional .rescue suffix. However due to a latent bug
neither the original or this recreated config disk are mapped to the
To correct this disk.config.rescue is now added to the disk_mapping for
the instance if a config disk is required during a rescue.
Hyper-V provides options to specify maximum IOPS per virtual disk
By leveraging this feature, this blueprint proposes to add support
for setting QoS specs targeting instance local disks as well
This will work similar to the libvirt driver, expecting the same

This cleans up stdout/stderr leaking in cmd testing by using the
pattern of MonkeyPatching stdout/stderr to a StringIO object where
appropriate.

The OutputStreamCapture fixture was using in one place, but that
actually is just about moving the output to the subunit stream. That
output will eventually be dumped at the end of the runs. When we
really don't want that to happen, we need to capture it directly.

Change-Id: Ib788ceccd72677d4602b6e6b77e74a4abff8fec5
""}]",375414,61813989391a69dc130dd7f5cd8bb73f5783c684,2750,Sean Dague,sdague,0,"Clean up stdout/stderr leakage in cmd testing
This cleans up stdout/stderr leaking in cmd testing by using the
pattern of MonkeyPatching stdout/stderr to a StringIO object where
The OutputStreamCapture fixture was using in one place, but that
actually is just about moving the output to the subunit stream. That
output will eventually be dumped at the end of the runs. When we
really don't want that to happen, we need to capture it directly.

openstack%2Fcongress~375183,openstack/congress,master,Ia6b2b3e9816c90d4ca6b687cca2fac90eb5fb9b3,Remove the traceback added by oslo-messaging RPC,MERGED,2016-09-23 01:13:11.000000000,2016-09-29 00:04:34.000000000,20,5,[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8215, 'name': 'Tim Hinrichs', 'email': 'timothy.l.hinrichs@gmail.com', 'username': 'thinrich'}, {'_account_id': 11278, 'name': 'Anusha Ramineni', 'email': 'anusha.ramineni@india.nec.com', 'username': 'anusha08'}, {'_account_id': 18591, 'name': 'Eric Kao', 'email': 'ekcs.openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'ekcs'}]",,8,"[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-23 19:13:25.000000000', 'files': ['congress/api/webservice.py'], 'message': ""Remove the traceback added by oslo-messaging RPC

Remove the traceback added by oslo-messaging RPC, to avoid
displaying traceback to user.

Some requests that return traceback w/o this patch, now normal:
$ openstack congress policy row list bob p
Not Found::table 'p' doesn't exist (HTTP 404) (Request-ID: req-54c2a117-0306-4fd2-8d71-8f7e6d130a43)
$ openstack congress policy rule list bob
The specified policy does not exist.::Policy ID bob does not exist
(HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-d85db619-afa0-4977-99f8-0dc88c5daa0c)
$ openstack congress policy delete bob
Policy Name or ID 'bob' does not exist (HTTP 404) (Request-ID: req-e1a70735-f469-4fae-b278-f061b64f4298)
$ openstack congress policy show bob
Resource bob not found (HTTP 404)

The 400 error should be addressed in separate patch.

Change-Id: Ia6b2b3e9816c90d4ca6b687cca2fac90eb5fb9b3
Closes-Bug: #1620868
""}]",375183,7f4c6bdeb8a4128faca9ae22eaed37792d64cbb0,18591,Eric Kao,ekcs,0,"Remove the traceback added by oslo-messaging RPC

If a facet field is marked 'nested' use a nested query type, otherwise
treat is as any other field. This patch adds 'nested' to the
magicsearch facet objects, and passes the entire facet definition
to the query build function (as well as the selected key/value pair).

Change-Id: I628691d93c4d864964e53e2c1fb69c796868db1f
Partial-Bug: #1621289
Depends-On: If4200fdff2db7bef49843a3ff611fc4edf2eea58
""}]",367677,0704a1af817d90b5086bd7d49dfdbb409a62e005,10063,Steve McLellan,sjmc7,0,"Honor 'nested' in facets

treat is as any other field. This patch adds 'nested' to the
magicsearch facet objects, and passes the entire facet definition
to the query build function (as well as the selected key/value pair).

The docs for the policy sample generator were inconsistent with how it
is typically used in practice, with just one namespace. This led to
questions about using one namespace when in reality that's what happens.
This patch brings the example more in line with reality.

openstack%2Fpython-tripleoclient~378667,openstack/python-tripleoclient,master,I583521c5c72a5377e9ee3047376c0f7bcf5fbdf6,Deprecate a number of CLI args that map directly to Heat params,MERGED,2016-09-28 14:27:00.000000000,2016-09-28 23:04:57.000000000,45,13,[{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7065, 'name': 'Brad P. Crochet', 'email': 'brad@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcrochet'}, {'_account_id': 9712, 'name': 'Dougal Matthews', 'email': 'dougal.matthews@canonical.com', 'username': 'dougal'}]",,1,"[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-28 16:28:31.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/utils.py'], 'message': 'Deprecate a number of CLI args that map directly to Heat params

For a while now the recommended approach for managing parameters has
been with a Heat environment file that is passed into the deploy
command. However, there are a number of CLI args that still map directly
to parameters. This change marks them as deprecated and includes
direction for users in the help message.

They can then be removed in a later release.

Change-Id: I583521c5c72a5377e9ee3047376c0f7bcf5fbdf6
'}]",378667,5c7c32a131ca7bcfb54c4a26ba2529f1f8ac0397,9712,Dougal Matthews,dougal,0,"Deprecate a number of CLI args that map directly to Heat params
For a while now the recommended approach for managing parameters has
been with a Heat environment file that is passed into the deploy
command. However, there are a number of CLI args that still map directly
to parameters. This change marks them as deprecated and includes
direction for users in the help message.
They can then be removed in a later release.

,['tripleoclient/utils.py']
